property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.value: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} instead.

property.name: Flavor

property.name: Artist

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.value: Kaja Foglio + Phil Foglio

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Artificer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {W}{W}, {T}: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fascinated by the lore of ancient struggles, the Archaeologist searches incessantly for remnants of an earlier, more powerful era.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Artificer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Through years of study and training, the Blacksmiths of Argive became adept at reassembling the mangled remains of the strange, mechanical creatures abounding in their native land.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kerstin Kaman

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't be blocked by artifact creatures. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by artifact sources. Enchanted creature can't be the target of abilities from artifact sources.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Eventually, mages learned to harness the power of natural damping fields and use it for their own ends.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Justin Hampton

property.name: Rules
property.value: As long as Martyrs of Korlis is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by artifacts is dealt to Martyrs of Korlis instead.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Margaret Organ-Kean

property.name: Rules
property.value: You gain X life, where X is twice the damage dealt to you so far this turn by artifacts.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Justin Hampton

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put any number of target artifact cards from target player's graveyard on top of their library in any order.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Drafna, founder of the College of Lat-Nam, could create a working model from even the smallest remnants of a newly unearthed artifact.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kaja Foglio

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This spell, attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

property.name: Artist
property.value: NéNé Thomas

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant artifact Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the mana in that cost to less than one mana.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Artificer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, search your library for an artifact card. If that card's mana value is less than or equal to the sacrificed artifact's mana value, put it onto the battlefield. If it's greater, you may pay {X}, where X is the difference. If you do, put it onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard. Then shuffle.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant artifact Whenever enchanted artifact becomes tapped or a player activates an ability of enchanted artifact without {T} in its activation cost, Artifact Possession deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Any black mage could coax a Thraxodemon to inhabit a magical device.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact. Activate only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia."Jarsyl, Diary

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sandra Everingham

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever an artifact becomes tapped or a player activates an artifact's ability without {T} in its activation cost, Haunting Wind deals 1 damage to that artifact's controller.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: These devices lured so many spirits that sometimes entire battlefields would become haunted at once.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Phyrexian Gremlin

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Phyrexian Gremlins during your untap step. {T}: Tap target artifact. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Phyrexian Gremlins remains tapped.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Phyrexian Human Cleric

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed artifact's mana value.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dan Frazier

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Phyrexian Demon

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sandra Everingham

property.name: Rules
property.value: Counter target artifact spell.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target artifact with mana value X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Randy Asplund-Faith

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Dwarf Artificer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate only during your upkeep.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Goblin Artificer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, draw a card. If you lose the flip, counter target artifact spell you control that isn't the target of an ability from another creature named Goblin Artisans.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Julie Baroh

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Mechanics deals 2 damage to any target.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Rules
property.value: Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After the rape of Argoth Forest during the rule of the artificers, the Pixies of Argoth bent their magic to more practical ends.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Treefolk by artifact sources.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Haunting cries we hear in our dreams As the forest dies, a death from machines.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Druid

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Citanul Druid.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Driven mad by the fall of Argoth, the Citanul Druids found peace only in battle.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its mana value.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Rules
property.value: Gaea's Avenger's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of artifacts your opponents control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After the destruction of Argoth, Gaea was willing to instill a portion of her own powers into some of her more vengeful followers.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever an artifact an opponent controls becomes tapped or an opponent activates an artifact's ability without {T} in its activation cost, you gain 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Forest of Argoth has developed a resistance to mechanical intrusion.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kerstin Kaman

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Margaret Organ-Kean

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock. At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player. {4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This horrid invention clearly illustrates why Mishra's lieutenant was feared as much by her troops as by her foes.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.) Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Rules
property.value: Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante. Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped. {4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If they do, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Rules
property.value: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it. At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it. {X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate only during your upkeep.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Randy Asplund-Faith

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step. {9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate only during your upkeep.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: Warrior born from a rocky womb.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Rules
property.value: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Richard Thomas

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: {1}, {T}: Each nontoken permanent with a name originally printed in the Antiquities expansion is sacrificed by its controller.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: From their earliest educations, the brothers had known that no human contrivance could stand against the true masters of Dominia.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kerstin Kaman

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dan Frazier

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Margaret Organ-Kean

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystical runes.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Rules
property.value: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}, {T}: Target player mills two cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kaja Foglio

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.) At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kaja Foglio

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to any target. Destroy Rocket Launcher at the beginning of the next end step. Activate only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7. Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Born like a Phoenix from the Flame, But neither Bulk nor Shape the same. - Jonathan Swift, "Vanbrug's House"

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dan Frazier

property.name: Rules
property.value: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Su-Chi dies, add {C}{C}{C}{C}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Flawed copies of relics from the Thran Empire, the Su-Chi were inherently unstable but provided useful knowledge for Tocasia's students.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Coffin during your untap step. {3}, {T}: Exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Tawnos's Coffin leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, return that exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the other exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dan Frazier

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, create that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted." At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens created with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Richard Thomas

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: It deals 1 damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion proved its versatility and usefulness in many of the later battles between the brothers.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Amy Weber

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if it wasn't sacrificed, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Randy Asplund-Faith

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: Defender (This creature can't attack.) First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sandra Everingham

property.name: Rules
property.value: Attacking creatures get -1/-0.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: During the brothers' childhood, Tocasia took them to explore the sacred cave of Koilos. There, in the Hall of Tagsin, Mishra discovered the mysterious weakstone.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Justin Hampton

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kaja Foglio + Phil Foglio

property.name: Rules

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kaja Foglio

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
